snippet: Pakistan’s Supreme Court issued a contempt-of-court notice against Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf on Wednesday, signaling a rerun of judicial proceedings that saw his predecessor ousted from office in June.
abstract: Pakistan's Supreme Court issues a contempt-of-court notice against Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf, signaling a rerun of judicial proceedings that saw his predecessor ousted from office in June; he is ordered to appear before the court and explain why his government refused to revive a corruption investigation into President Asif Ali Zardari's finances in Switzerland. Photo (M)

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and SALMAN MASOOD

lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan -- The Supreme Court issued a contempt-of-court notice against Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf on Wednesday, signaling what appeared to be a rerun of judicial proceedings in which his predecessor was ousted from office in June.A five-member bench ordered Mr. Ashraf to appear before the court on Aug. 27 to explain why his government had refused to revive a corruption investigation into President Asif Ali Zardari 's finances in Switzerland.

headline.main: New Premier In Pakistan Faces Order From Court
